Module WitchHunt
Package fr.sos.witchhunt.model.cards

Class RumourCard

java.lang.Object
fr.sos.witchhunt.model.cards.Card
fr.sos.witchhunt.model.cards.RumourCard
All Implemented Interfaces:
Resettable
Direct Known Subclasses:
AngryMob, BlackCat, Broomstick, Cauldron, DuckingStool, EvilEye, HookedNose, PetNewt, PointedHat, TheInquisition, Toad, Wart
public abstract class RumourCard extends Card

Represents a Rumour card.

A Rumour card has a Witch? effect, a Hunt! effect and sometimes an additionnal effect which grants protection against other Rumour cards.

Is abstract. A class extending this one must be created for each Rumour card : see for example Pet Newt.

When creating a Rumour card's class, you must always instantiate its Witch? and Hunt! effects' with a definition for their Effect.perform() and Effect.isAllowed() methods. You must also provide a description and a default value for these effects using their constructor.

You can create a card with no additional effects using the unparameterized constructor, or a card with additional effects using the parameterized constructor. The card's characteristics (risked, able to give cards, and/or offensive) can be modified when extending. By default, they are all set to false.

A Rumour card's picture is automatically loaded based on its class name. When adding a new Rumour card with a class named "className" to the game, make sure you add its picture at "/images/cards/"+className+".png".

A Rumour card is associated with integer values : its additional effect's value, and its Witch? and Hunt! effects' values.

These characteristics, as well as these integer values, are used for computing the default card's value for CPU players' strategies.

A Rumour card is directly associated with its additional value and its characteristics, whereas its Witch? and Hunt! effects' values are associated with the card's effects.

A Rumour card can be used by players in the following ways : + triggering its Witch? effect when defending against an accusation (has to be unrevealed, becomes revealed) + triggering its Hunt! effect on the player's turn (has to be unrevealed, becomes revealed) + reset by a player who has already used it (has to be revealed) + discarded to the common pile of Rumour cards, or taken from the pile (reset when taken) + exchanged between players' hands (reset when taken)

  • Field Details

    • witchEffect

      protected Effect witchEffect
      This Rumour card's Witch? effect. Must be instantiated when this class is extended.
      See Also:
      • WitchEffect

    • huntEffect

      protected Effect huntEffect
      This Rumour card's Hunt! effect Must be instantiated when this class is extended.
      See Also:
      • HuntEffect

    • additionalEffectDescription

      protected String additionalEffectDescription
      This Rumour card's additional effect's description. For now, all additional effects grant a protection against other specific Rumour cards. Excepted for the first line, you can use the "/+/" special sequence in order to make a multiline paragraph with a view-managed indentation. Empty string by default, redefinition is optional.

    • defaultAdditionalValue

      protected int defaultAdditionalValue
      This Rumour card's default additional effect's value. 0 by default, redefinition is optional.
      See Also:
      • CardValue
      • grantsImmunityAgainst(RumourCard)

    • givesCards

      protected boolean givesCards
      This characteristic is true if this card is able to make you take other cards from the pile or from other players' hands. false by default, redefinition is optional.
      See Also:
      • CardValue::givesCards()

    • isRisked

      protected boolean isRisked
      This characteristic is true if this card is, in its initial state, risked. false by default, redefinition is optional.
      See Also:
      • CardValue::isRisked()

    • isOffensive

      protected boolean isOffensive
      This characteristic is true if this card has offensive effects (forcing other players to discard a card...). false by default, redefinition is optional.
      See Also:
      • CardValue::isOffensive()

    • image

      protected BufferedImage image
      The Rumour card's picture. Loaded automatically based on its class name.

      When adding a new Rumour card with a class named "className" to the game, make sure you add its picture at "/images/cards/"+className+".png".

  • Constructor Details

    • RumourCard

      public RumourCard()
      Default, unparameterized, constructor. Only loads the card's picture. The card will have no additional effect.

    • RumourCard

      public RumourCard(String additionalEffectDescription, int defaultAdditionalValue)

      Parameterized constructor. for cards with an additional effect.

      loads the card's picture by calling the super constructor.

      Define the additional effect at instanciation by overriding method grantsImmunityAgainst(RumourCard) (because, for now, all additional effects only give a protection against another specific Rumour card.

      Parameters:
      additionalEffectDescription - The card's additional effect's description.
      defaultAdditionalValue - This Rumour card's default additional effect's value.
      See Also:
      • additionalEffectDescription
      • CardValue.getAdditionalValue()

  • Method Details

    • witch

      public boolean witch()

      Performs this Rumour card's Witch? effect, if it is allowed.

      This verification is optional as it is already performed by players before choosing an action, but it could be useful if new Rumour cards that would force players to trigger a Witch? effect were to come.

      Returns:
      true if the card's witch effect was allowed, false otherwise.

    • hunt

      public boolean hunt()

      Performs this Rumour card's Hunt! effect, if it is allowed.

      This verification is optional as it is already performed by players before choosing an action, but it could be useful if new Rumour cards that would force players to trigger a a Hunt! effect were to come.

      Returns:
      true if the card's witch effect was allowed, false otherwise.

    • getDefaultValue

      public CardValue getDefaultValue()

      Creates a CardValue (used by CPU players' strategies to choose their actions) based on this Rumour card's values for its Witch? effect, for its Hunt! effect and for its additional effect, and on its boolean characteristics (risked, able to give cards, and/or offensive).

      Returns:
      The Card's default value, used by CPU players' strategies.
      See Also:
      • CardValue
      • CPUPlayer
      • CPUStrategy
      • Effect.getValue()
      • Effect.getValue()
      • givesCards
      • isRisked
      • isOffensive

    • grantsImmunityAgainst

      public boolean grantsImmunityAgainst(RumourCard rc)

      Defines whether a Rumour card grants immunity against another specific one when one of its effects is performed.

      By default, false. Can be redefined to return true when this one card is revealed.

      If redefined, don't forget to give this card a description for its additional effec≈ß as well as a default additional value. You can use for this purpose the parameterized constructor.

      See for example the Broomstick Rumour card, which protects against the AngryMob Rumour card.

      Parameters:
      rc - The Rumour card against which immunity is granted.
      Returns:
      By default,false. Can be redefined to return true when this one card is revealed.
      See Also:
      • Broomstick protects against Angry Mob
      • AngryMob
      • additionalEffectDescription
      • defaultAdditionalValue

    • canWitch

      public boolean canWitch()
      Whether this card's Witch? effect can be witch() performed or not.
      Returns:
      true only if its Witch? effect is allowed in the current situation and if this card is Card.isRevealed() not revealed.
      See Also:
      • Player::canWitch()
      • Player::chooseDefenseAction()

    • canHunt

      public boolean canHunt()
      Whether this card's Hunt! effect can be hunt() performed or not.
      Returns:
      true only if its Hunt! effect is allowed in the current situation and if this card is Card.isRevealed() not revealed.
      See Also:
      • Player::canHunt)
      • Player::chooseTurnAction()

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Automatically builds the Rumour card's name based on its class name. A space is appended before each uppercase letter that is not the first one. For example, calling this method on an extension the class of which is named AngryMob will return the string "Angry Mob". Make sure you give new Rumour cards a class name written in upper CamelCase and corresponding to the card's name.
      Returns:
      The extension's class name, with a space before each uppercase letter that is not the first one.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Overrides:

      Returns:
      getName()

      public String getWitchEffectDescription()

    • getHuntEffectDescription

      public String getHuntEffectDescription()

    • getAdditionalEffectDescription

      public String getAdditionalEffectDescription()

    • loadImage

      private final void loadImage()

      Loads the card's picture (in its unrevealed state), from a path based on its class name.

      The picture is resized to the chosen normalized size for all cards.

      See Also:
      • getImagePath()
      • Card.resizeCardImage(BufferedImage)

    • getImagePath

      private final String getImagePath()

      A Rumour card's picture is expected to be found at "/images/cards/"+className+".png", className being the extension's class name.

      When adding a new Rumour card with a class named "className" to the game, make sure you add its picture at "/images/cards/"+className+".png".

      If you want to load an image with another name, override this method for your extension.

      Returns:
      The extension's image path, computed automatically based on the extension's class name.

    • getImage

      public BufferedImage getImage()
